radiographic_examinations.findings: No evidence of pulmonary embolism; multifocal areas of ill-defined ground-glass opacities and consolidation in all lobes; scattered discrete nodules, some with a surrounding ground-glass halo; small pleural effusion on the left and a loculated pleural effusion within the right major fissure; multiple pleural or pleural-based nodules; right breast implant with a surrounding minimally enhancing soft-tissue mass containing foci of gas, extending through the chest wall into the anterior mediastinum.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive dyspnea developed since the patient's initial presentation, with hypoxemia and pulmonary infiltrates noted at the time of admission.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Persistent diffuse bilateral air-space opacities with multiple coalescing pulmonary nodules.
